RenderTarget is a texture on which provided Sprite hierarchy can be rendered. It can be used in any case in which Texture can be used. Creates new RenderTarget object width of rendered texture height of rendered texture Whether or not the texture is filtered. Whether or not the texture is repeating. Whether or not the actual texture size should be scaled to match display resolution.
Clears rendered texture with provided color and opacity color using which to clear the texture transparency using which to clear the texture relative x coordinate relative y coordinate width of the area to clear starting from x coordinate height of the area to clear starting from y coordinate
Renders provided object or object hierarchy as a texture. any sprite inherited object or object hierarchy to render (this object doesn't need to be added to the stage hierarchy) The x start position of the texture The y start position of the texture
Returns single pixels color and alpha channel x coordinate of pixel y coordinate of pixel color in hex alpha value from 0 to 1
Returns buffer containing color and alpha data from provided rectangle x coordinate of pixel y coordinate of pixel width of rectangle to include in buffer height of rectangle to include in buffer buffer with color and alpha data
save contents of RenderTarget as image filename and path to store file, like |D|image.png x coordinate from where to start image y coordinate from where to start image width of the image to save height of the image to save
--original bitmap local source = Bitmap.new(Texture.new("crate.png", true))
--render target local rt = RenderTarget.new(source:getWidth(), source:getHeight())
--bitmap with rendertarget as texture local bmp = Bitmap.new(rt) bmp:setPosition(200, 0) stage:addChild(bmp)
--updating source updated Bitmap local frame = 0 stage:addEventListener(Event.ENTER_FRAME, function(event) local r = math.sin(frame * 0.03) * 0.3 + 0.7 local g = math.sin(frame * 0.04) * 0.3 + 0.7 local b = math.sin(frame * 0.05) * 0.3 + 0.7 source:setColorTransform(r, g, b, 1) frame = frame + 1 rt:draw(source) end)
